The attached Carfax history report lists no accidents or mileage inconsistencies in this Vantage's past.

Factory equipment includes 19-inch wheels, a limited-slip differential, a power-operated soft top, Graphite interior trim, power-adjustable front seats, a wind deflector, a 700-watt sound system, and rear parking sensors, according to a window sticker shown in the gallery. The seller reports no modifications.

Styled under the guidance of Henrik Fisker, the Vantage made its debut during the 2006 model year. It had a tall order to fill: make the British brand accessible to a wider target audience by luring enthusiasts out of Porsche showrooms. It succeeded thanks largely to its powerful V8 engine and its surprisingly well-tuned chassis. Production ended in 2017, though its V12-powered sibling lived on until 2018.
Power comes from a 4.3-liter V8, rated at 380 horsepower and 302 lb-ft of torque. It spins the rear wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission.

https://carsandbids.com/auctions/3R6qmgO.dougs_take: The VA Subaru WRX STI is the last of its kind, as Subaru confirmed they won't be making another STI. That's a shame, because these are amazing cars – benefitting from a potent turbocharged flat-4 paired with a 6-speed manual transmission and all-wheel drive — and this one comes equipped with the Active Torque Vectoring system, heated Performance-design seats, and the obligatory rear wing. This STI also boasts a number of performance modifications, such as an ECU tune, various Cobb upgrades, and upgraded brakes. It also touts a clean, accident-free Carfax report, adding even more peace of mind. Kudos to the seller for adding a thorough photo gallery, too – which enhances this STI's appeal even more.
auction_highlights: The attached Carfax history report lists no accidents in this Subaru's past.

Factory equipment includes 18-inch wheels, Brembo brakes, a Driver Controlled Center Differential, LED headlights, a trunk spoiler, a sunroof, heated Performance-Design front seats, a power-adjustable driver's seat, a 7-inch touchscreen for the infotainment system, and a 9-speaker Harman Kardon sound system.

Modifications to this STI are extensive, and the full list is detailed below. Highlights include a Stage3Motorsports tune, a Cobb flex fuel kit and Accessport V3 ECU tuner, Stoptech rotors, and aerodynamic accessories.

Launched for 2015, the VA-generation WRX and WRX STI were split from the Impreza that they were based on. They became standalone models, not merely sporty evolutions of a compact car, and their new identity was accompanied by a more muscular-looking design plus the assortment of engine and chassis tweaks fans expected. Production ended in 2021, and Subaru confirmed the STI won't return.

Power comes from a 2.5-liter turbocharged flat-4, rated at 305 horsepower and 290 lb-ft of torque when left stock. The modifications increase those figures to 315 and 358, respectively, at the wheels, according to a dyno sheet shown in the gallery. The engine spins the four wheels via a 6-speed manual transmission.
